t: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David.
Deliver*p me, O Lord,*s from the evil man: preserve me from the violent man;
Which*p imagine mischiefs in their heart; continually are they gathered together for war.
They*p have sharpened their tongues like a serpent; adders' poison is under their lips. Selah.
Keep*p me, O Lord,*s from the hands of the wicked; preserve me from the violent man; who have purposed to overthrow my goings.
The*p proud have hid a snare for me, and cords; they have spread a net by the wayside; they have set gins for me. Selah.
I*p said unto the Lord,*s Thou art my God: hear the voice of my supplications, O Lord.*s
O*p God*s the Lord, the strength of my salvation, thou hast covered my head in the day of battle.
Grant*p not, O Lord,*s the desires of the wicked: further not his wicked device; lest they exalt themselves. Selah.
As*p for the head of those that compass me about, let the mischief of their own lips cover them.
Let*p burning coals fall upon them: let them be cast into the fire; into deep pits, that they rise not up again.
Let*p not an evil speaker be established in the earth: evil shall hunt the violent man to overthrow him.
I*p know that the Lord*s will maintain the cause of the afflicted, and the right of the poor.
Surely*p the righteous shall give thanks unto thy name: the upright shall dwell in thy presence.
